decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and card draw to efficiently control the game while also utilizing the Gifts Ungiven package to tutor for specific cards. It includes a range of powerful artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly establish board presence and out-value the opponent. Additionally, it includes a powerful combo with Underworld Breach and Brain Freeze to potentially mill out the opponent in just a few turns. The overall strategy is to control the game, disrupt the opponent's plans, and win through card advantage and powerful combo finishers.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with Hatebear cards that impose additional costs on spells, such as Chancellor of the Annex and Archon of Emeria, while also deploying aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Clarion Conqueror to apply pressure. The deck utilizes mana acceleration from Moxen and lands like Ancient Tomb to quickly establish a board presence, while also including disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to further hinder opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plans while quickly establishing a threatening board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to use the dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, then bring back powerful creatures like Ichorid and Prized Amalgam for continuous pressure. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to further fuel the graveyard, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful combo strategy. Additionally, disruptive cards like Grief and Force of Will help protect the combo and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive spells while utilizing Gifts Ungiven to search for key combo pieces or control elements. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and graveyard recursion through cards like Gifts Ungiven, Underworld Breach, and Brain Freeze. With the ability to efficiently disrupt the opponent's game plan and assemble powerful combos, this control deck seeks to manipulate the game in its favor and win through either overwhelming control or combo finishes.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Doomsday combo to set up a winning game state quickly. By using cards like Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Demonic Tutor to dig for key pieces, the deck aims to assemble the combo of Doomsday, Thassa's Oracle, and other necessary cards to win the game in one turn. The deck also includes disruption through Force of Will, Mental Misstep, and Flusterstorm to protect the combo from opponent's interference. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the deck to recur key cards from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard mechanics to quickly assemble a powerful board state, maximizing the use of cards like Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp to fuel explosive combos. The goal is to rapidly fill the graveyard with key creatures and spells using Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder, while also disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void. By consistently dredging cards and leveraging the graveyard for value, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless combination of creatures and spells.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies while also maintaining a strong aggressive presence. By utilizing hatebear creatures like Archon of Emeria and Anointed Peacekeeper, along with disruptive lands like Wasteland and Void Mirror, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan. At the same time, cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer provide card advantage and a strong offensive front. With an efficient mana base and powerful mana accelerants like Lotus Petal and Moxen, this deck looks to quickly establish dominance and control the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Oath of Druids card to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Oko, Thief of Crowns. It also includes a variety of counterspells and disruption cards to control the game and protect your creatures. Additionally, cards like Show and Tell and Flash can be used to cheat out big threats early on. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast creature deployment and efficient control spells to dominate the game.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disruption and resource denial to control the game. The deck utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to stop opponent's threats, while removal spells like Fatal Push take care of creatures. Card advantage is gained through card draw spells like Treasure Cruise and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes a strong mana denial package with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a companion to the deck, providing additional card advantage and utility.

This deck aims to control the game using counter spells and disruptive cards while setting up for a powerful combo with Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also utilizes cards like Show and Tell to cheat out big threats early in the game. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly establishing a dominant board presence. Ultimately, the key strategy is to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-winning combos.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Shambling Shell in order to bring creatures back from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. Cards like Noxious Revival and Creeping Chill help to maintain card advantage and drain the opponent's life total. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo pieces. The goal is to efficiently combo off and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck aims to control the opponent's actions through countering spells and disrupting their game plan, while also utilizing the Gifts Ungiven mechanic to search for key cards in the deck. It includes powerful cards such as Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Ancestral Recall to maintain control over the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for the recursion of certain cards from the graveyard. The deck focuses on efficiently managing resources and outmaneuvering the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with cards like Psychic Frog and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck also includes powerful spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay to control the board and protect its threats. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Treasure Cruise provides additional versatility and card advantage, making it a flexible and resilient deck that can adapt to different matchups and strategies.

The deck focuses on using a combination of early disruption spells, like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with powerful control cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Swords to Plowshares to control the game and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes card advantage spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to maintain resources while applying pressure with cards like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters. The inclusion of a powerful companion like Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds additional versatility and resilience to the deck's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts, utilizing cards like Manifold Key and The One Ring to generate additional value and close out games quickly. By combining efficient mana acceleration from artifacts like Moxen and Grim Monolith with disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, the deck can disrupt opponents' strategies while establishing a strong board presence. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile tool to tutor for key artifacts like Time Vault or Pithing Needle, providing flexibility and adaptability in different matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board control through the use of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, while also utilizing powerful card advantage engines such as Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from the graveyard, adding extra resilience and flexibility to the deck's game plan. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal, while pushing for a quick win through aggressive creature beats.
